newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee ends steady in kerb, seen volatile.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee ends steady in kerb, seen volatile.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee closed steady at 42.53 to the dollar on Monday in the kerb, after opening up at 42.43 and dealers said it was likely to continue to fluctuate on Tuesday.
They said opening rates of the dollar attracted buying interest, but the market lacked clear direction.
The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rate, last changed on October 22, was 40.1200/40.3206 to the dollar.
The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed at 6.30 percent, compared to Sunday's close at 6.20 percent.
